definition: to use/to employ/to have to/to eat or drink/expense or outlay/usefulness/hence/therefore

sentences.english: Not every idiom translates with such ease.
sentences.chinese: 要鬧清楚每個習慣用語的意思是不容易的。

sentences.english: And a number of different sports have contributed idioms to the English language.
sentences.chinese: 許多不同的運動都爲英語貢獻了很多習慣用語。

sentences.english: This was originally a term used in the theater.
sentences.chinese: 這是一個源自劇場的慣用語。

sentences.english: Try to Remember idioms and sentences with the first calling, make sure to remember deeply.
sentences.chinese: 儘量用第一人稱來記習慣用語和句型，以便記憶牢固。

sentences.english: There are quite a lot of three-character idioms playing an active role in Cantonese.
sentences.chinese: 廣州話裏活躍着許多三字格慣用語。

sentences.english: What troubles me most is that I can't learn all these English idioms by heart.
sentences.chinese: 最困擾我的是我無法背誦出所有這些英語慣用語。

sentences.english: Resembling or having the nature of an idiom.
sentences.chinese: 要鬧清楚每個習慣用語的意思是不容易的。

sentences.english: Today, our focus will be on football idioms.
sentences.chinese: 今天我們來學習與足球相關的習慣用語。

sentences.english: English words in pairs are one of the most important parts of English idioms.
sentences.chinese: 英語成對詞是英語慣用語的主要組成部分之一。

sentences.english: This time take note how idioms are funny and thus easy to remember.
sentences.chinese: 這次請用筆記下來，看看習慣用語是多麼有趣好懂。

sentences.english: Here are some of the most common phrases used when speaking to your cat in the morning.
sentences.chinese: 以下是你早上起牀後跟貓咪交流最常用的一些慣用語。

sentences.english: Grab your toothbrush, pack some comfortable shoes, and update your inoculations.
sentences.chinese: 帶上牙刷，穿上舒適的鞋子，並且更新您的慣用語。

sentences.english: Look at the idioms below. Each one is connected to horses.
sentences.chinese: 請看下列習慣用語，它們都與馬有關。

sentences.english: Use I when you record or memorize sentences or words.
sentences.chinese: 抄錄和記憶句型與慣用語時，要用單數第一人稱。

sentences.english: Could you please explain for us the characteristics of idioms?
sentences.chinese: 您來給我們講一講習慣用語的特點，好嗎？

definition: language component/morpheme/individual characters (making up an expression)
lit. the clumsy bird flies early (idiom); fig. to work hard to compensate for one's limited abilities
(phonology) coda, the part of a syllable that follows its vocalic nucleus (e.g. "u" in kòu or "n" in běn)
